title: Register a birth
description: Register your baby's birth within 42 days - this is a legal requirement in Barbados
overview: You must register your baby's birth within 42 days of the birth. This creates an official record and allows you to get a birth certificate, which you'll need for many services including applying for a passport, enrolling in school, and accessing healthcare.

steps.title: Gather required documents
steps.description: Collect all necessary documentation before visiting the registry office. You'll need proof of the birth, parent identification, and marriage certificate if applicable.

steps.title: Visit the Civil Registration Department
steps.description: Attend the Civil Registration Department in person with all required documents. Both parents should attend if possible, or the attending parent must have authorization.

steps.title: Complete the birth registration form
steps.description: Fill out the official birth registration form with accurate information about the child, parents, and birth details. Staff will verify all information.

steps.title: Pay registration fees
steps.description: Pay the required registration fee. Additional fees apply if you want certified copies of the birth certificate immediately.

steps.title: Receive birth certificate
steps.description: Collect your baby's birth certificate. If not available immediately, you'll be told when to return or it may be mailed to you.
steps.duration: Same day or within 5 working days

requirements: Hospital birth notification or medical certificate of birth
Valid photo identification for both parents
importantNotes: Registration is free if done within 42 days of birth
Both parents should attend if possible
Late registration incurs additional fees and may require additional documentation
Birth certificates are required for passports, school enrollment, and many other services
